account.description: The $ACCOUNT variable contains the name of the end user’s logon account or current directory.

base.description: The $BASE variable contains database connection information for a specified table.

batch.description: The $BATCH variable distinguishes between operations running in batch mode and those running in online mode.

blobfile.description: The $BLOB_FILE variable contains a file location of a BLOB.

box.description: The $BOX variable draws a box or lines on screen.

count.description: The $COUNT variable contains the number of records currently read in a report.

cpumsec.description: The $CPUMSEC variable contains the current CPU consumption in milliseconds.

cutoff.description: The $CUTOFF variable contains the cutoff year used by the application.

date.description: The $DATE and $DATES variables both contain the current date in YYYYMMDD format.

dates.description: The $DATE and $DATES variables both contain the current date in YYYYMMDD format.

dbmserr.description: The $DBMS_ERRMESS variable contains a DBMS error message.

dbmserrno.description: The $DBMS_ERRNO variable contains the number of a DBMS error message.

devprn.description: The $DEVPRN variable queries the profile for a printer name.

systemerror.description: The $ERRSYS variable contains an error number representing the status of an operating-system command.

file.description: The $FILE variable contains a table identification number.

gencom.description: The $GENCOM variable passes environment variables with a routine accessed by the CALL verb.

group.description: The $GROUP variable contains the name of the end user’s logon group or current directory.

if.description: The $IF variable evaluates a logical condition.

line.description: The $LINE variable contains the current line number, and the $LINES variable contains the total lines printed in a report.

lines.description: The $LINE variable contains the current line number, and the $LINES variable contains the total lines printed in a report.

location.description: The $LOCATION variable contains the physical location of a structure. See also “Structures” on page 560.

logon.description: The $LOGON variable contains the system identifier or logon name under which the current session was begun.

onmicount.description: The $OMNI_COUNT variable contains the number of records qualified by an Omnidex keyword query.

page.description: The $PAGE variable contains the current report page number.

pageheight.description: The $PAGEHEIGHT variable contains the number of lines in a given physical printer page.

pagewidth.description: The $PAGEWIDTH variable contains the number of columns in a given physical printer page.

parent.description: The $PARENT variable returns the name of a section.

pin.description: The $PIN variable contains the process identification number of the current Speedware program.

printerdefaulttype.description: The $PRINTER_DEFAULT_TYPE variable contains the default printer type.

printerdefaultdevice.description: The $PRINTER_DEFAULT_DEVCLASS variable contains the default printer device class.

procstatus.description: The $PROC_STATUS variable contains the return status of a user-defined procedure or function. See also “User-defined procedures” on page 568.

profile.description: The $PROFILE variable extracts information from the profile.

random.description: The $RAND variable contains a random number.

reactor.description: The $REACTOR variable contains the name and location of the Speedware executable file running the current section.

recordnumber.description: The _RECNUM variable contain the current record number.

record.description: The _RECORD variable contains the contents of the current record buffer.
record.example: _RECORD [[byte1:byte2]] represents the bytes in a substring.

recordbyitem.description: The _RECORD_BY_ITEM variable contains the contents of the current record buffer.

sectionduration.description: The $SECTION_DURATION variable reports the elapsed time of a section.

sectionname.description: The $SECTION_NAME variable contains the name of the current section.

sectionid.description: The $SESSION_ID variable reports the Speedware Autobahn session identification number.

sqldynamicstatement.description: The $SQLDYNSTATUS variable contains the status of an SQL dynamic statement.

sqlerror.description: The $SQLERROR variable contains the status of the current SQL statement.

sum.description: The $SUM variable contains the current cumulative total of a numeric item in a REPORT section.

takecount.description: The $TAKE_COUNT variable returns the number of records in the take file.

time.description: The $TIME or $TIMES variable contains the current system time (hardware time).

times.description: The $TIME or $TIMES variable contains the current system time (hardware time).

title.description: The $TITLE variable contains the section or application title.

user.description: The $USER variable contains the name, and the $USERNO variable contains the level number of the current end user.

userno.description: The $USER variable contains the name, and the $USERNO variable contains the level number of the current end user.

version.description: The $VERSION variable contains the version number of the Speedware program running the application.
